meanings.definition: Relating to the act of appointing or assigning a position or task.
meanings.sent1: The appointive role of team captain was given to Sarah.
meanings.sent2: The appointive process for selecting a new manager was thorough.
meanings.sent3: The appointive decision to make the cat the boss of the house was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her appointive leadership style guided the team to success.
meanings.sent5: The appointive responsibility of organizing the event fell on John's shoulders.

meanings.definition: Capable of being appointed or designated for a specific role or duty.
meanings.sent1: The appointive candidate for the job had impressive qualifications.
meanings.sent2: The appointive nature of the position allowed for flexibility in responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The appointive cupcake was the star of the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her appointive skills in problem-solving made her an asset to the team.
meanings.sent5: The appointive employee quickly adapted to new tasks with ease.
